newsitem.title: USA: France Telecom files offering at SEC.
newsitem.headline: France Telecom files offering at SEC.

text.p: France Telecom filed on Monday with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to offer shares or American depositary shares with a proposed maximum value of $100 million.

The Paris-based telecommunications company did not provide specific terms of the offering in the preliminary filing but said it will be underwritten by Merill Lynch & Co, Lehman Brothers and Banque Paribas. Global coordinators are Banque Paribas and Banque Nationale de Paris.
Proceeds from the sale will be paid to the French State, the world's fourth largest telecommunications company said.
The company said it is also offering shares in France.
